alert.note: Alert for Chouteau; Fergus; Judith Basin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 6:24PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Judith Basin, southwestern Fergus, south central Chouteau Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 623 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Geyser to near Hobson. Movement was north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stanford, Denton, Hobson, Geyser, Danvers, Coffee Creek, Windham, Moccasin, Ackley Lake State Park, Utica and Benchland. This includes Highway 200 between mile markers 13 and 66. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for central and north central Montana.
